Pre-Game Insights: The New York Times is writing articles about the match.
Drake has been making money off the match.
Baseball fans have been triggered by the cricket match.
India is eager to tap into the cricket market in the USA, considering they own three of the six franchises in the country's premier T20 competition.
The LA Olympics organising committee mentioned Virat Kohli and his social media following as part of the reason for allowing cricket in the 2028 Games.
The BCCI secretary had a meeting with the NFL offices.
The USA team has played a part in creating tight finishes and rapturous upsets, making the public want more cricket.
Aaron Jones epitomized skill and flair in the tournament opener, striking sixes at will and celebrating each of them.
The USA team took down Pakistan in their second match, showing potential to progress into the Super Eights.
Shivam Dube needs support in the Indian dressing room due to his recent poor form, but he may be needed in the West Indies.
Corey Anderson, who was seen hitting a 36-ball century in 2014, hasn't played internationally since November 2018 but is still sought after by various T20 leagues.
Both teams are expected to field unchanged XIs barring any injury concerns.
The New York pitch has settled, reducing the scary up-and-down bounce seen earlier in the competition.
The game is unlikely to be affected by the weather but may be low-scoring.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The USA team went into the match undefeated, with two wins from two.
The USA team has every chance of progressing into the Super Eights.
There will be a first cricket match between India and the USA across any format.
Aaron Jones is the second-highest scorer in the T20 World Cup with 130 runs from two innings at a strike rate of nearly 197.
Andries Gous is in fourth place with 100 runs from two innings at a strike rate of almost 139.
Jasprit Bumrah has an average of four and an economy rate of 2.85 after picking up five wickets for 20 runs in seven overs this tournament.
